page.title: 03Tourism at Denbigh Castle
page.content: An average of{600 visitors a week entered{Denbigh castle}during{June and {July '85.}Some were locals, some had seen it publicised, others passing by had seen it on its{hill-top}and had their curiosity aroused. In order to attract{tourism}and involve it more in the life of the district the castle is the focus for a series of events to bring it{'alive'.}This is part of a Heritage in Wales campaign launched by Cadw:{Welsh Historic Monuments founded {Oct. 1984}to protect and help conserve ancient monuments.{Cadw}encourages local events to be staged at the {Castle}which provides a lovely setting and an attractive back-drop for many activities.{Local schools}provided a variety of{entertainment}which included{traditional Welsh songs, folk and{clog dancing,dramatic events}and {instrumental items.
